Class BerryBush

java.lang.Object
plants.Plant
plants.BerryBush
All Implemented Interfaces:
itumulator.executable.DynamicDisplayInformationProvider, itumulator.simulator.Actor, itumulator.world.NonBlocking
public class BerryBush extends Plant implements itumulator.simulator.Actor, itumulator.executable.DynamicDisplayInformationProvider, itumulator.world.NonBlocking
Represents a berry bush in the simulation world. The `BerryBush` provides nutritional value to herbivores and can grow new bushes and replenish its berries after depletion. It interacts with the world dynamically as an actor and provides visual information for display.

    • BerryBush

      public BerryBush(itumulator.world.World world, itumulator.world.Location location)

      location - The location of the bush in the world.

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act(itumulator.world.World world)
      Defines the behavior of the berry bush during each simulation step. If the bush is depleted, it tracks the steps since depletion and replenishes itself after a set number of steps. else, it attempts to grow new bushes.
      Specified by:
      act in interface itumulator.simulator.Actor
      Parameters:
      world - The simulation world.

    • consume

      public void consume()
      Reduces the bush's nutritional value and marks it as depleted.
      Overrides:
      consume in class Plant

    • replenish

      private void replenish()
      Replenishes the bush by resetting its nutritional value and texture.

    • getInformation

      public itumulator.executable.DisplayInformation getInformation()
      Provides the display information for the berry bush. The texture changes based on whether the bush is depleted or not.
      Specified by:
      getInformation in interface itumulator.executable.DynamicDisplayInformationProvider
      Returns:
      A `DisplayInformation` object containing the bush's color and texture.

    • isDepleted

      public boolean isDepleted()
      Checks whether the bush is currently depleted.
      Returns:
      `true` if the bush is depleted, otherwise `false`.
